version_description: Bug fixes!

This update improves the readability of the Listen view in NPR One by supporting the Larger Text accessibility feature on your phone. Any changes you have made to the text settings on your phone will now be reflected in the app when you look to read what story or podcast is currently playing. We will be improving the readability of other areas of NPR One such as Explore and your Profile view in upcoming app updates.


NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.
Improved accessibility support.
Fix for issue causing crashes on iOS 8.
We've made some additional improvements to Accessibility support, now tapping content in Explore will properly identify the item and associated show.

Keep up with the latest election coverage from NPR by checking out Election Essentials. This is where the people who cover the election keep their very best stuff. It's everything you need to know about the Presidential campaign from the Republican and Democratic National Conventions. When you have time to get caught up, it's ready for you. Come back over and over, because the political team at NPR News is filling it up all the time.

Have you used Listen Later yet? Tap the 'Later' button on stories or podcast episodes that you want us to remember for you. All of these stories and episodes will appear in a new section at the bottom of your Explore view, and you can save up to twenty stories and podcast episodes to Listen Later. For now, your Listen Later stories and episodes won't be available offline, but we are working on this feature in an upcoming update.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Listen to “Songs We Love” in NPR One. A fresh set of songs hand-picked weekly by NPR Music editors, you might just discover a new favorite artist from this eclectic mix of genres and moods. Tap the icon in Explore menu to enter the channel.

This update also includes stability improvements to accessibility and CarPlay.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

New! Get notified when there are new episodes of the podcasts you follow. Here's how to follow a podcast and opt-in to notifications:
• Search for your favorite podcasts, or find them from your Featured Shows in Explore. Tap on the podcast logo and then tap 'Follow' on the podcast page where all of the episodes are listed
• When asked, just tap 'YES' to receive a notification on your phone when there is a new episode available
• Change your mind? Simply go to the 'Notifications' section in your Profile page and toggle the option off

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Introducing an improved NPR One experience on Chromecast! Cast NPR One to your home speakers or TV to catch up on the latest news, to play the newest episode of the NPR Politics Podcast, or to hear great stories from your local NPR member station. Once you start casting, NPR One will continuously play the very best of public radio. Use your iOs device as your remote to skip, pause, or to play something recommended for you from Explore.

Start casting NPR One with Chromecast, Chromecast Audio, or any Google Cast-enabled speakers or TVs.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

It's the run up to Election Day 2016 and NPR has you covered. Tap on Election Essentials to hear the latest stories about the election, or follow the popular NPR Politics Podcast to hear daily episodes to stay up to date on the latest coverage. Be sure to turn on notifications for the Politics Podcasts so you'll know when there's something new.

Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

The election's over. But the new president doesn't officially take office until January 20th. There's lots to unpack before then – the aftermath of the election, the end of the Obama era, and what a new administration will bring. You'll find those stories and more in the brand new Road To Inauguration deep dive collection. All picked by the NPR Politics team. Come back over and over. It's always ready when you need to catch up.

Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Introducing a new Deep Dive collection called In Case You Missed It. ICYMI is a mix of NPR One's most popular stories. These are stories that are hand picked by our editorial curators from the stories listeners have loved the most. It's a wide range of topics that are worth knowing about. Listen to ICYMI along with the Transition Deep Dive which unpacks the effects of the election, the end of the Obama era, and what a new administration will bring.

Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Introducing your Home Station Page, a new way to easily dive into the most important news, stories and podcasts from your Home Station. These are local stories, locally reported and delivered just for you.

Find your Home Station Page by tapping on News & Stories under your station's logo in the new menu. From there you'll be able to dive into the most important stories and featured podcasts from your station and your community.

• Shows. Explore the shows and podcasts that represent the stories and voices from your community. See a showcase of recommended podcasts from your station listed first and then tap More to dive into every show your station produces.
• News and Stories. Listen to the stories that are meaningful to your community. Your station will curate the most important stories you see right at the top of the list. Tap on More to see all of the most important news and stories from your station.
• Newscast. Catch up to the latest newscast from your station (when available) by tapping the play button on Local Newscast.
• Live Radio. Tune into your station's live radio stream by tapping on Live Radio. NPR One will take you to right to the live stream in your browser. Just tap play and you'll soon start listening to live radio.

Community is everything. Connect with your Home Station today.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Introducing your Home Station Page, a new way to easily dive into the most important news, stories and podcasts from your Home Station. These are local stories, locally reported and delivered just for you.

Explore the shows and podcasts that represent the stories and voices from your community. View the News and Stories that are meaningful to your community and Catch Up on the latest newscast from your station. And tap on Live Radio to tune into your station's live radio stream in your browser.

Find your Home Station Page by tapping on News & Stories under your station's logo in the navigation menu.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Some people still don’t “get” podcasts – why they are special and how to listen. NPR One listeners can help change that. Think of someone you care about – what podcast would they really love? Share it with them via clicking the “share” button on NPR One or just show them, IRL, how to listen. Let’s get more people to try podcasts — use the hashtag #trypod (get it? t-r-y pod) to spread the love.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

We've resolved an issue with podcast episode notifications. Thanks to everyone who reported this to us.

And for you new listeners, here's a quick reminder on how to get notified when new episodes of the podcasts you follow are available.
• Search for your favorite podcasts, or find them from your Featured Shows in Explore. Tap on the podcast logo and then tap 'Follow' on the podcast page where all of the episodes are listed
• When asked, just tap 'YES' to receive a notification on your phone when there is a new episode available
• Change your mind? Simply go to the 'Notifications' section in the navigation drawer and toggle the option off

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Introducing the new "What's On Your Plate?" deep dive. Whatever you’re doing now, odds are that sometime pretty soon, you’ll be EATING. We all eat. Food is fuel, pleasure, habit, history. It may cost a little or a lot. Be good for us or not so good. It binds us to friends and connects us to strangers. So we’ve gathered together a mix of NPR's best stories about how and what we eat. Dig in and bon appétit!!

And catch the new season of Invisibilia. Season 3 is available now. Be sure to follow the show to ensure that you hear the latest episode and more show like it.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

Thanks to everyone's feedback we've improved the continuous listening experience of NPR One.

Take a listen to the new 'Take Me There' deep dive in NPR One. 'Take Me There' is NPR's signature, immersive storytelling. Stories told on location. Stories told from the center of the action. Stories that transport you. Put your headphones on and let us take you there -- to the story...to another environment...or into another person's shoes.

Thanks to everyone's feedback we've made improvements to the battery performance in this latest version of NPR One.

NPR One continues to evolve. Please join our Facebook or Google+ communities, or tweet to @NPRone with any feedback. Thanks for listening and for supporting public radio.

At NPR, we understand how important privacy is to you, and we are committed to transparency about how we collect, use and share your information. Please take a moment to read our privacy policy: https://n.pr/privacypolicy.

iPhone X Support is finally here. This latest version of the app will now go edge to edge on devices that support it — iPhone X and newer. Thank you to everyone who reached out requesting this feature and for your patience.

We've also added in a few bug fixes and other improvements to optimize the experience.

NPR One continues to evolve — stay tuned for more updates coming soon.

Please keep the feedback coming. We want to hear from you! Tweet @NPRHelp with any feedback or questions or contact us at https://help.npr.org. Thank you for listening and supporting public radio.

iPhone X Support is finally here. This latest version of the app will now go edge to edge on devices that support it — iPhone X and newer. Thank you to everyone who reached out requesting this feature and for your patience.
We've also added in a few bug fixes and other improvements to optimize the experience.

NPR One continues to evolve — stay tuned for more updates coming soon.

Please keep the feedback coming. We want to hear from you! Tweet @NPRHelp with any feedback or questions or contact us at https://help.npr.org. Thank you for listening and supporting public radio.

The latest version of NPR One improves Voiceover support, helping make NPR One accessible for all. Voiceover now performs more consistently when viewing story details – from Search, Explore, Podcast, and Station Pages.
The latest version of NPR One includes stability improvements

This release includes fixes for several bugs, most prominently resolving some issues with our Apple CarPlay integration. This latest release should fix those bugs and get you back to listening successfully in your CarPlay-enabled vehicle. Thanks to everyone who reported this.

NPR One continues to evolve - stay tuned for more updates coming soon.

Please keep the feedback coming - we want to hear from you! Tweet to @NPRHelp with any feedback or questions or contact us at https://help.npr.org. Thank you for listening and supporting public radio.
Bug fixes and stability improvements

This version contains several fixes to address user reports of increased battery usage. Thanks to all our users who have reached out with this feedback. We will continue to monitor this issue, so please let us know if it persists.

NPR One continues to evolve - stay tuned for more updates coming soon.

Please keep the feedback coming - we want to hear from you! Tweet to @NPRHelp with any feedback or questions or contact us at https://help.npr.org. Thank you for listening and supporting public radio.
Bug fixes and stability improvements
Bug fixes and stability improvements.

Enjoy NPR One on the go? This version introduces the ability to connect NPR One with Waze. You can listen and control your audio experience directly in the Waze app or get turn-by-turn directions in the NPR One experience.

NPR One continues to evolve — stay tuned for more updates soon. We want to hear from you! Tweet @NPRHelp with any feedback or questions or contact us at https://help.npr.org. Thank you for listening and supporting public radio.
Bug fixes and stability improvements.
Bug fixes and stability improvements
Bug fixes and stability improvements
With this release we have redesigned the login experience and now support Sign In with Apple. It also includes bug fixes and performance improvements. As always, we appreciate your feedback.

Introducing the NPR One home screen – your place for the content and stories you like best.

The new home screen will be your dedicated space to easily:
- Press play and listen to NPR One’s on-demand mix of news and podcasts
- See new episodes of your favorite podcasts
- Pick up news stories and episodes from where you left off
- Listen to live radio from your local NPR station

This is just the first step of many to make NPR One more personalized to you and we want to know what you think! Please send us any questions or feedback via our quick form at http://help.npr.org.
You can now share text articles. We also tuned some things up behind the scenes.
